pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps package¶

Submodules¶

pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps.fitting module¶

pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps.fitting.basis_cos(j, x)[source]¶
pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps.fitting.basis_leg(j, x)[source]¶
pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps.fitting.nonparametric_fit(data, error, U, lType='NSS', JRange=[1, 100])[source]¶
INPUT: data (array)
error (array) U (array) Orthogonal basis matrix
OUTPUT: dic (dictionary, keys: nbf, Risk, EDoF)
Outputs a dictionary containing the nonparametric best fit (nbf) of the data with respect to the basis. Also returns the risk function (Risk) and the effective degrees of freedom (EDoF). The algorithm follows 1107.0516v2.
pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps.fitting.npf_makeU(x, basis)[source]¶

Module contents¶

pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps.KL_divergence(p, q)[source]¶
INPUT: p (array) a modal fraction
q (array) a modal fraction
OUTPUT: kl (positive real number)
Returns the Kullback-Liebler divergence from q to p. Note that divergence is not symmetric. For more on the information measure see: add website
pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps.entropy(p)[source]¶
OUTPUT: h (positive real number)
Returns the Shannon Entropy of the p distribution.
pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps.modal_fraction(ell, Cl)[source]¶
INPUT: ell (integer array)
Cl (array)
OUTPUT: mf (array)
Calculates the modal fraction of an angular power spectrum. Incorporates the 2*ell+1 Jacobian factor coming from the sum over all the m’s.
pyCE.cosmology.analysis.aps.norm(p)[source]¶
OUTPUT: p (array)
Returns an L1-normalized array.
